keywords.name: Capture Page Screenshot
keywords.doc:
Capture current web page as image png file.

The ``filename`` argument specifies filename and path to save the file.
Default valid is 'puppeteer-screenshot-{index}.png'.

The ``fullPage`` argument specifieds capture screenshot as full page.

Example:

| Capture page screenshot   |                    |
| Capture page screenshot   | custom-{index}.png |

keywords.name: Checkbox Should Be Selected
keywords.doc: Valicate checkbox should selected

keywords.name: Checkbox Should Not Be Selected
keywords.doc: Valicate checkbox should not be selected

keywords.name: Clear Element Text
keywords.doc:
Clears value of text field identified by ``locator``.

Example:

| `Clear Element Text`                   | id:name          |

keywords.name: Click Button
keywords.doc:
Clicks button identified by ``locator``.

Example:

| `Click Button`                                | id:submit          |

keywords.name: Click Element
keywords.doc:
Clicks element identified by ``locator``.

The ``noWaitAfter`` argument specifies skip wait for animation after click.
Only support for webkit and safari (Puppeteer)

Example:

| `Click Element`         | id:register          |            |
| `Click Element`         | id:register          | ${True}    |

keywords.name: Click Element At Coordinate
keywords.doc: Click element at specifict coordiate x and y offset

keywords.name: Click Image
keywords.doc:
Clicks image identified by ``locator``.

Example:

| `Click Image`                                 | id:cat_image          |

keywords.name: Click Link
keywords.doc:
Clicks link identified by ``locator``.

Example:

| `Click Link`                                  | id:view_more          |

keywords.name: Close All Browser
keywords.doc: Close all browser

keywords.name: Close Browser
keywords.doc: Closes the current browser

keywords.name: Close Window
keywords.doc: Close current browser tab/page

keywords.name: Delete All Cookies
keywords.doc: Deletes all cookies.

keywords.name: Disable Debug Mode
keywords.doc: Disable debug mode. This keyword will close all browser and reset debug mode to False.

keywords.name: Element Should Be Disabled
keywords.doc: Verifies that element identified by locator is disabled.

keywords.name: Element Should Be Enabled
keywords.doc: Verifies that element identified by locator is enabled.

keywords.name: Element Should Be Visible
keywords.doc: Verifies that element identified by locator is visible.

keywords.name: Element Should Contain
keywords.doc: Verifies that element locator contains text `expected`.

keywords.name: Element Should Not Be Visible
keywords.doc: Verifies that element identified by locator is not be visible.

keywords.name: Element Should Not Contain
keywords.doc: Verifies that element locator should not contains text `expected`.

keywords.name: Element Text Should Be
keywords.doc: Verifies that element locator contains exact the text `expected`.

keywords.name: Element Text Should Not Be
keywords.doc: Verifies that element locator not contains exact the text `expected`.

keywords.name: Enable Debug Mode
keywords.doc:
Enable debug mode.

The ``slowMo`` argument specifies delay for each test step.
The ``devtools`` argument specifies enable devtools or not.

Example:

| Enable Debug Mode |                       |      |
| Open browser      | http://127.0.0.1:7272 |      |
| Input text        | id:username_field     | demo |
| Input text        | id:password_field     | mode |

keywords.name: Enable Emulate Mode
keywords.doc:
Emulate specific mobile or tablet

The ``emulate_name`` argument specifies which emulator to use.
Only support for chrome (Puppeteer)

| = Example Options = |
| iPhone X            |
| Pixel 2             |

More emulate_name please visit [device_descriptors.py](https://github.com/qahive/robotframework-puppeteer/tree/master/PuppeteerLibrary/utils/device_descriptors.py)

keywords.name: Execute Javascript
keywords.doc:
Executes the given JavaScript code

Examples:
| `Handle Alert`       | ACCEPT                |
| `Execute Javascript` | alert('Hello world'); |


Examples:
| `Execute Javascript` | console.log('Hi 5');  |

keywords.name: Get Element Attribute
keywords.doc: Return the value of ``attribute`` from the element.

keywords.name: Get Element Count
keywords.doc: Returns the number of elements matching ``locator``.

keywords.name: Get Location
keywords.doc: Get page location

keywords.name: Get Selected List Label
keywords.doc: Return the label of selected option from element.

keywords.name: Get Selected List Labels
keywords.doc: Return the label list of selected options from element.

keywords.name: Get Selected List Value
keywords.doc: Return the value of selected option from element.

keywords.name: Get Selected List Values
keywords.doc: Return the value list of selected options from element.

keywords.name: Get Text
keywords.doc:
Returns text value of element identified by ``locator``.

Example:

| ${text}                                    | `Get Text`          | id:username |

keywords.name: Get Title
keywords.doc: Get page title

keywords.name: Get Value
keywords.doc:
Returns specific attribute value of element identified by ``locator``.

Example:

| ${value}                                    | `Get Value`          | id:comment |

keywords.name: Get Window Count
keywords.doc: Get windows count

keywords.name: Go Back
keywords.doc: Simulate browser go back

keywords.name: Go To
keywords.doc: Navigates the current page to the ``url``

keywords.name: Handle Alert
keywords.doc:
Handles the current alert and returns its message.

action:
- ACCEPT: Accept the alert i.e. press Ok. Default.
- DISMISS: Dismiss the alert i.e. press Cancel.`.

Example:

| `Run Async Keywords` |                  |     |
| ...    Handle Alert  | ACCEPT           | AND |
| ...    Click Button  | id=alert_confirm |     |

Limitation:
Not support for webkit

keywords.name: Input Text
keywords.doc:
Types the given text into text field identified by ``locator``.

If clear is true, the input element will be cleared before the text is typed into the element.
On the other hand clear is false, the previous text will not be cleared from the element.

Examples:
| `Input Text` | id:name     | John Doe    |      |
| `Input Text` | id:username | john        | True |

keywords.name: Maximize Browser Window
keywords.doc: Maximize view port not actual browser and set default size to 1366 x 768

keywords.name: Mock Current Page Api Response
keywords.doc:
Mock current page api response.

The ``mock_response`` is a dictionary which can have the following fields:
- ``status`` (int): Response status code, defaults to 200.
- ``headers`` (dict): Optional response headers.
- ``contentType`` (str): If set, equals to setting ``Content-Type`` response header.
- ``body`` (str|bytes): Optional response body.

The ``url`` is request url. url can be partial url match using regexp
Match Options:

| Options            | Url value                                        |
| Exact match        | ^http://127.0.0.1:7272/ajax_info.json\?count=3$ |
| Partial match      | /ajax_info.json\?count=3                        |
| Regular expression | .*?/ajax_info.json\?count=3                     |

The ``method`` is HTTP Request Methods:
- GET (default)
- POST
- PUT
- HEAD
- DELETE
- PATCH

The ``body`` is request body message. body can match using regexp

Example:

| &{response}                    | Create Dictionary          | body=I'm a mock response |
| Mock Current Page Api Response | /ajax_info.json\?count=3  | ${response}              |

keywords.name: Mouse Down
keywords.doc: Mouse down on the element.

keywords.name: Mouse Move
keywords.doc: Move mouse to position x, y.

keywords.name: Mouse Over
keywords.doc: Mouse over the element.

keywords.name: Mouse Up
keywords.doc: Mouse up.

keywords.name: Open Browser
keywords.doc:
Opens a new browser instance to the specific ``url``.

The ``browser`` argument specifies which browser to use.

|    = Browser =         |    = Name(s) =   |
| Google Chrome          | chrome           |
| Webkit (Safari engine) | webkit           |
| Firefox                | firefox          |

The ``options`` argument as a dictionary

|    = Property =    |        = Value =       |
| headless           | default True           |
| width              | default 1366           |
| height             | default 768            |
| emulate            | iPhone 11              |

Example:

| &{options} =   | create dictionary                             | headless=${False}  |
| `Open browser` | https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_forms.asp | options=${options} |

keywords.name: Press Keys
keywords.doc:
Press Keys

Simulates the user pressing key(s) to an element or on the active page. 
A superset of the `key` values can be found here. Examples of the keys are:
`F1` - `F12`, `Digit0`- `Digit9`, `KeyA`- `KeyZ`, `Backquote`, `Minus`, `Equal`, `Backslash`, `Backspace`, `Tab`, `Delete`, `Escape`, `ArrowDown`, `End`, `Enter`, `Home`, `Insert`, `PageDown`, `PageUp`, `ArrowRight`, `ArrowUp`, etc.
Please refer to a key https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/key/Key_Values

keys arguments can contain one or many strings

Example:

| `Press Keys`        | None              | A        |       |
| `Press Keys`        | id=password       | Enter    |       |
| `Press Keys`        | id=password       | A        | Enter |

keywords.name: Print As Pdf
keywords.doc:
Print current web page as pdf file. This keyword only support with ``HEADLESS`` mode enable.

The ``filename`` argument specifies filename and path to save the file.
Default valid is 'pdf-{index}.pdf'.

Example:

| &{options} =   | create dictionary                             | headless=${False}  |
| Open browser   | https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_forms.asp | options=${options} |
| Print as PDF   |                                               |                    |
| Print as PDF   | custom-pdf-{index}.pdf                        |                    |

keywords.name: Reload Page
keywords.doc: Reload the current page

keywords.name: Run Async Keywords
keywords.doc:
Executes all the given keywords in a asynchronous and wait until all keyword is completed

``Return`` Array of result for each keywords based on index

Example:
| Open browser         | ${HOME_PAGE_URL}      | options=${options}          |     |
| `Run Async Keywords` | Click Element         | id:login_button             | AND |
| ...                  | Wait for response url | ${HOME_PAGE_URL}/home.html  |     |

keywords.name: Run Async Keywords And Return First Completed
keywords.doc:
Executes all the given keywords in a asynchronous and wait until first keyword is completed

``Return`` Array of result for each keywords based on index

Example
| `Run Async Keywords And Return First Completed` | Wait for response url | ${HOME_PAGE_URL}/login.html | AND  |
| ...                                             | Wait for response url | ${HOME_PAGE_URL}/home.html  |      |

keywords.name: Scroll Element Into View
keywords.doc: Scroll element into view

keywords.name: Select Checkbox
keywords.doc: Select checkbox based on locator

keywords.name: Set Timeout
keywords.doc:
Sets the timeout that is used by various keywords.
The value can be given as a number that is considered to be seconds or as a human-readable string like 1 second.
The previous value is returned and can be used to restore the original value later if needed.
See the Timeout section above for more information.

Example:

| Open page that loads slowly |                  |            |
| Set Timeout                 | ${orig timeout}  |            |

keywords.name: Switch Browser
keywords.doc: Switch browser context based on alias name

keywords.name: Switch Window
keywords.doc:
Switches to tabs matching locator
locator support options NEW, MAIN and query using name, title and url
    - NEW: latest opened window
    - MAIN: main window
    - title="QAHive": window title. Page title will have have error if new tab have auto redirection
    - url="https://qahive.com": url support regex Example: url=.*qahive.com

keywords.name: Unselect Checkbox
keywords.doc: Unselect checkbox based on locator

keywords.name: Upload File
keywords.doc: Upload file

keywords.name: Wait For Navigation
keywords.doc:
Waits until web page navigates to new url or reloads.

Example:

| Open browser       | ${HOME_PAGE_URL}        | options=${options}          |      |
| Input Text         | id:username             | foo                         |      |
| Input Text         | id:password             | bar                         |      |
| Run Async Keywords | Click Element           | id:login_button             | AND  |
| ...                | `Wait For Navigation`   |                             |      |

keywords.name: Wait For New Window Open
keywords.doc:
Waits until new page or tab opens.

Example:

| Run Async Keywords | Click Element              | id:view_conditions          | AND  |
| ...                | `Wait For New Window Open` |                             |      |

keywords.name: Wait For Request Url
keywords.doc:
Wait until web application sent request to ``url``.

The ``url`` is request url. url can be partial url match using regexp
Match Options:

| Options            | Url value                              |
| Exact match        | ^http://127.0.0.1:7272/ajax_info.json$ |
| Partial match      | /ajax_info.json                        |
| Regular expression | .*?/ajax_info.json                     |

The ``method`` is HTTP Request Methods:
- GET (default)
- POST
- PUT
- HEAD
- DELETE
- PATCH

The ``body`` is request body message. body can match using regexp

``Return`` request msg  with properties {url, method, body}

Example:

| Open browser       | ${HOME_PAGE_URL}       | options=${options}   |      |               |
| Input Text         | id:username            | foo                  |      |               |
| Input Text         | id:password            | bar                  |      |               |
| Run Async Keywords | Click Element          | id:login_button      | AND  |               |
| ...                | `Wait For Request Url` | ${URL_API}/login     | POST | username=demo |

keywords.name: Wait For Response Url
keywords.doc:
Wait until web application received response from ``url``.

The ``url`` is response url.

The ``status`` is HTTP Status Codes:
- 200 (default)
- 201
- 204
- 400
- 401
- 404
- 500
Reference:[https://restfulapi.net/http-status-codes/|https://restfulapi.net/http-status-codes/]

``Return`` request msg  with properties {url, status, body}

Example:

| Open browser       | ${HOME_PAGE_URL}        | options=${options}          |      |               |
| Input Text         | id:username             | foo                         |      |               |
| Input Text         | id:password             | bar                         |      |               |
| Run Async Keywords | Click Element           | id:login_button             | AND  |               |
| ...                | `Wait For Response Url` | ${URL_API}/login            | 200  | username=demo |

keywords.name: Wait Until Element Contains
keywords.doc:
Waits until ``locator`` element contains ``text``.

Example:

| Open browser                       | ${HOME_PAGE_URL}        | options=${options}          |
| `Wait Until Element Contains`      | css:#container p        | Please input your user name |

keywords.name: Wait Until Element Does Not Contains
keywords.doc:
Waits until ``locator`` element does not contains ``text``.

Example:

| Run Async Keywords                     | Click Element                 | id:login_button             | AND  |
| ...                                    | Wait For Navigation           |                             |      |
| `Wait Until Element Does Not Contains` | css:#container p              | Please input your user name |      |

keywords.name: Wait Until Element Finished Animating
keywords.doc:
Waits until the specific element is finished animating.
Check by check element position.

keywords.name: Wait Until Element Is Enabled
keywords.doc: Waits until the specific element is Enabled.

keywords.name: Wait Until Element Is Hidden
keywords.doc:
Waits until ``locator`` element is hide or removed from web page.

Example:

| Run Async Keywords                 | Click Element           | id:login_button             | AND  |
| ...                                | Wait For Navigation     |                             |      |
| `Wait Until Element Is Hidden`     | id:login_button         |                             |      |

keywords.name: Wait Until Element Is Visible
keywords.doc:
Waits until ``locator`` element is displayed on web page.

Example:

| Run Async Keywords                 | Click Element           | id:login_button             | AND  |
| ...                                | Wait For Navigation     |                             |      |
| `Wait Until Element Is Visible`    | id:welcome              |                             |      |

keywords.name: Wait Until Location Contains
keywords.doc:
Waits until the current URL contains `expected`.

The `expected` argument contains the expected value in url.

keywords.name: Wait Until Location Does Not Contains
keywords.doc:
Waits until the current URL does not contains `expected`.

The `expected` argument contains the expected value must not in url.

keywords.name: Wait Until Page Contains
keywords.doc:
Waits until ``text`` appears on current page.

Example:

| Run Async Keywords                 | Click Element                 | id:login_button             | AND  |
| ...                                | Wait For Navigation           |                             |      |
| `Wait Until Page Contains`         | Invalid user name or password |                             |      |

keywords.name: Wait Until Page Contains Element
keywords.doc:
Waits until ``locator`` element appears on current page.

Example:

| Open browser                       | ${HOME_PAGE_URL}        | options=${options} |
| `Wait Until Page Contains Element` | id:username             |                    |

keywords.name: Wait Until Page Does Not Contains
keywords.doc:
Waits until ``text`` disappears on current page.

Example:

| Run Async Keywords                  | Click Element                 | id:login_button             | AND  |
| ...                                 | Wait For Navigation           |                             |      |
| `Wait Until Page Does Not Contains` | Please input your user name   |                             |      |
